column3: مناطق تجميع المياه الطبيعية في تاميرا

column2: avec Sepp Holzer et Benrd Müller
column3: مع سيب هولزر و بيرند ميلر

column2: Water is the most important thing.
The whole world is 70% water.
We, animals, everything-70% water.
column3: كما أننا والحيوانات وكل شيء 70% منه ماء

column2: Water is the key issue for the survival human kind on this planet.
column3: المياه هي قضية أساسية لبقاء الجنس البشري على هذا الكوكب

column2: Nature has provided enough water everywhere on earth;
column3: لقد وفرت الطبيعة ما يكفي من المياه في كل مكان على الأرض

column2: but, a billion people do not have sufficient access to clean drinking water.
column3: لكن هنالك مليار شخص لا يحصلون على ما يكفي من مياه الشرب النظيفة

column2: More and more regions lack the water to grow the food they need.
column3: المزيد من المناطق تفتقر إلى المياه المستخدمة لزراعة المواد الغذائية التي يحتاجونها

column2: Centralized systems of artificial water management cannot solve this problem.
column3: لا يمكن للنظم المركزية لإدارة المياه الاصطناعية أن تحل هذه المشكلة

column2: We need de-centralized systems of natural water management.
column3: نحن بحاجة إلى نظم لامركزية لإدارة المياه الطبيعية

column2: We are in Tamera Peace Research Center in southern Portugal, where a water retention landscape has been in development since summer 2007.
column3: نحن في مركز بحوث السلام - تاميرا في جنوب البرتغال حيث ما زالت مناطق تجميع المياه الطبيعية تحت التطوير منذ صيف 2007

column2: Bernd Muller is responsible for Tamera's ecological research work.
column3: بيرند ميلر هو المسؤول عن أعمال البحوث البيئية في تاميرا

column2: In 2007 the community of Tamera still had the question whether a site of this size threatened by desertification could provide food, water and energy for 300 people.
column3: في عام 2007 كان المجتمع في تاميرا ما يزال يتسائل ما إذا كان موقع بهذا الحجم

column2: We visited Sepp Holzer and asked him this question and he brought us this gift the vision of a water landscape.
column3: قمنا بزيارة سيب هولزر وسألناه هذا السؤال فأحضر لنا هذه الهدية الرؤية للمناطق الطبيعية المائية

column2: Sepp Holzer, an Austrian mountain farmer, is a well-known specialist and visionary for permaculture and landscape healing.
column3: سيب هولزر، مزارع من الجبال النمساوية متخصص معروف وذا رؤية حول الزراعة المعمرة وشفاء المناطق الطبيعية

column2: Water is always at the core of his work.
column3: المياه دائما موجودة في جوهر عمله

column2: For me water is the most important capital.
column3: بالنسبة لي المياه هي أهم رأس مال

column2: Wherever it's possible, you should create retention spaces and collect the rain water and re-learn with the water how to maintain a balance.
column3: فحيثما وجدت يجب أن تقام مساحات استبقاء وتجمع لمياه الأمطار ومع الماء علينا إعادة تعلم كيفية الحفاظ على التوازن

column2: This is the most important thing because once you've created the right hydrological balance,
column3: هذا هو أهم شيء لأنه بمجرد أن خلقت التوازن الهيدرولوجي الصحيح

column2: 70% of the work is done.
column3: فهذا يعني أن 70% من العمل قد أنجز

column2: ou help rich vegetation to develop, diversity ecause nature can reveal itself and develop in the right way.
column3: ثم بإمكانك مساعدة الحياة النباتية الغنية أن تتطور وبتنوع لأن الطبيعة يمكن أن تكشف عن نفسها وتتطور في الاتجاه الصحيح

column2: Traveling through the world I have not seen a single situation, nation or land in which the development of a water retention landscape would not give the first important healing impulses.
column3: في سفري عبر العالم لم أشاهد حالة واحدة أو أمة أو أرض لم يعطها تطوير مناطق لتجميع المياه أولى نبضات الشفاء الهامة

column2: In many parts of the world, countries are not able to feed their population anymore.
column3: في أجزاء كثيرة من العالم بلدان لم تعد قادرة على إطعام سكانها بعد الآن

column2: They have been unable to maintain their natural wildlife for a long time.
column3: وهي لم تكن قادرة على الحفاظ على الحياة البرية الطبيعية لديها لفترة طويلة

column2: As a consultant in many countries
Sepp Holzer sees the consequence of deforestation, monoculture, overgrazing and industrial agriculture.
column3: يرى سيب هولزر عواقب إزالة الغابات والرعي الجائر والزراعة الأحادية والصناعية

column2: All these factors destroy the natural water balance.
column3: كل هذه العوامل تدمر التوازن الطبيعي للمياه

column2: The soil is drying out.
Water is being lost and the retention space, the natural water storage system of the earth, is becoming dry and the flora and fauna disappear.
column3: والمياه يتم فقدانها ومساحة التجميع ونظم تخزين المياه الطبيعية للأرض ستصبح جافة

column2: In the end the land will turn into desert or burn ecause it's so dry.
column3: وفي النهاية سوف تتحول الأراضي الى صحراء أو ستحترق الغابات لأنها جافة جدا

column2: You can see these problems happening all over the world, bringing huge catastrophes.
column3: يمكنك أن ترى هذه المشاكل تحدث في جميع أنحاء العالم جالبة بذلك كوارث ضخمة

column2: And the heavy rains come anyway.
column3: وتأتي الأمطار الغزيرة على أي حال

column2: What happens then?
The water rushes down the slopes because the dry soil does not absorb the water.
column3: الماء يندفع أسفل المنحدرات لأن التربة الجافة لا تمتص الماء

column2: When the soil is hotter than the falling rain it rejects the water.
column3: عندما تكون التربة أكثر سخونة من الأمطار المتساقطة فهي ترفض الماء وتطرحه بعيدا

column2: Only when the soil is cooler, when the vegetation is giving shadow then it attracts the water and lets it seep in.
column3: فقط عندما تكون التربة أبرد وعندما يعطي الغطاء النباتي ظل حينئذ يمكنها جذب الماء وتتيح له أن يتسرب فيها

column2: This is the construction site for a new water retention space in Tamera.
column3: هذا هو موقع البناء لمنطقة تجميع ماء جديدة في تاميرا

column2: Wherever you work with soil you can read the signs of erosion.
column3: اينما عملت مع التربة يمكنك قراءة علامات التآكل

column2: Topsoil should actually form a thick, living layer everywhere on the ground which enables rainwater to filter in.
column3: في الواقع ينبغي أن تشكل التربة السطحية طبقة سميكة للمعيشة في كل مكان على الأرض والتي تمكن فيها مياه الأمطار من التصافي

column2: But, this layer has been eroded away.
Now the topsoil lies in layers many meters thick in the bottom of valleys or is found as mud in rivers.
column3: الآن تكمن التربة السطحية داخل أمتار من طبقات سميكة في قاع الوديان أو توجد على شكل طين في الأنهار

column2: The surface of fields and sites higher up is depleted and barren.
column3: سطح الحقول والمناطق المرتفعة مستنزفة وقاحلة

column2: De-centralized water retention landscapes give the water time to filter back into the earth body.
column3: تعطي مناطق تجميع المياه اللامركزية وقت لمياه الامطار حتى تملأ جسم الأرض مرة اخرى

column2: People always have the same questions, always the same worries, where will all this water come from ?
column3: الناس لديهم دائما نفس الأسئلة ودائما نفس المخاوف من أين ستأتي كل هذه المياه؟

column2: in such dusty dry soil without streams or a river.
column3: في مثل هذه التربة الجافة والمغبرة دون مجاري للأنهار

column2: How can I build a lake here ?
People have simply lost the knowledge of how to use the catchment area and the rain, the blessing of the water in the right way.
column3: لقد فقد الناس معرفة كيفية استخدام منطقة مستجمعات المياه والمطر بركة الماء بالطريق الصحيح

column2: When I use the catchment area, thereupon, the lake will fill very quickly.
column3: عندما أستخدم منطقة مستجمع ستتراكم وتتشكل بركة أو بحيرة بشكل سريع جدا

column2: How much water can change a landscape in a short time.
column3: كمية المياه يمكنها أن تغير المنظر الطبيعي في وقت قصير

column2: We can see here, comparing Tamera before the creation of Lake 1 and today.
column3: يمكننا أن نرى ذلك هنا بمقارنة تاميرا قبل إنشاء البحيرة 1 واليوم

column2: Water retention landscapes can be built everywhere.
column3: يمكن بناء المناطق الطبيعية لتجميع الماء في كل مكان

column2: Anywhere on earth.
A water retention space must not be sealed with concrete or plastic.
column3: يجب عدم صقل منطقة تجميع الماء بالخرسانة أو البلاستيك

column2: It is enough to build a dam out of natural material at the narrowest point of a valley.
column3: يكفي بناء سد من المواد الطبيعية في أضيق نقطة من الوادي

column2: You dig a ditch until you reach an impermeable layer.
column3: عليك أن تحفر خندق حتى تصل إلى طبقة محكمة وغير نافذة

column2: On that solid ground you apply layer after layer of fine material, like moist clay and drive on it and roll it to build the water barrier.
column3: على تلك الأرضية الصلبة تضع طبقة فوق طبقة من المواد الناعمة مثل الطين الرطب وتتدحرج عليه وتلفه

column2: This water barrier is the core of the dam.
column3: حاجز المياه هذا هو أساس السد

column2: For the outside of the dam I take course material, it doesn't have to be dense and water-proof.
column3: للمنطقة الخارجية للسد تستخدم المواد الخشنة لا يجب أن تكون كثيفة أو مضادة للماء

column2: I will also have to compact it by driving on it and rolling it.
column3: سوف تكون بحاجة أيضا الى الإصلاح من خلال الدحرجة عليها ولفها

column2: And like this, I build the whole dam, the water barrier in the core nd on the outside in a slope of 1 to 2, 1 meter up and 2 meters along, like this I build the two layers together, up to the top.
column3: وبهذا الشكل يتم بناء السد بأكمله حاجز المياه في الأساس وفي الخارج بمنحدر 5.

column2: The water retention spaces have winding banks, shallow and deep zones, a diverse vegetation of water plants and are built aligned to the prevailing wind direction this way the water is always moving, is enriched with oxygen,
column3: مناطق تجميع المياه لديها ضفاف متعرجة ومناطق ضحلة وعميقة وتنوع نباتي من نباتات مائية

column2: and thus is naturally purified.
The water in a water retention landscape stays fresh and alive by itself.
column3: الماء في مناطق تجميع المياه تبقى عذبة ونشطة من تلقاء نفسها

column2: Since we created the first retention space, we can already keep much of the water from the winter rainfalls on the land.
column3: منذ إنشاء أول منطقة لتجميع المياه يمكننا بالفعل الاحتفاظ بالكثير من المياه عن هطول الأمطار في فصل الشتاء على الأرض

column2: In this way in can unfold its full healing capacity, the wildlife is responding and is returning and the vegetation is recovering.
column3: وبهذه الطريقة يمكنها أن تتكشف قدرتها على الشفاء الكامل الحياة البرية تستجيب وتستعاد والغطاء النباتي يتعافى

column2: We can plant fruit trees again, the forests recover and we can grow our food for people and for animals in the direct surroundings of the first retention space.
column3: يمكننا زراعة أشجار الفاكهة مرة أخرى الغابات تتعافى ويمكننا زراعة محاصيلنا الغذائية

column2: The water which used to run away and which is now stored here is at the same time also having an impact on the whole groundwater system.
column3: المياه التي كانت تتسرب والتي هي الآن مخزنة أيضا لديها تأثير على نظام المياه الجوفية كلها

column2: In the first year, a spring developed below this lake which now gives water throughout the year.
column3: في السنة الأولى نشأ ينبوع تحت هذه البحيرة والذي يعطي الآن المياه على مدار السنة

column2: Since we built this first dam, we no longer have such big variations with a lot of flowing water in winter when it's raining and droughts in the summer.
column3: و منذ أن بني أول سد لم يعد لدينا تباينات كبيرة من هذا القبيل الكثير من المياه المتدفقة في فصل الشتاء عند نزول المطر والجفاف في فصل الصيف

column2: We have a more constant water situation throughout the year, which is of course a huge benefit for nature.
column3: . لدينا وضع أكثر ثباتا للمياه على مدار السنة والذي هو بالطبع فائدة كبيرة للطبيعة

column2: Nature shows you how this works, you just have to ask her, have to contact her, to communicate with her, then you will be fine anywhere on earth.
column3: الطبيعة تبين لكم كيف يعمل هذا عليك فقط أن تسألها وتتواصل معها

column2: Ask nature, think with her and not against her.
column3: إسأل الطبيعة فكر معها وليس ضدها ضع نفسك مكانها

column2: Put yourself in her place and you get all the answers you need.
column3: ثم ستحصل على كل الأجوبة التي تحتاج إليها

column2: Make room in your head so that natural thinking has space to happen.
column3: إفسح المجال داخل رأسك حتى تخلق مساحة للتفكير الطبيعي بأن يحدث

column2: There has been abnormal mutant activity in the Tohoku area.
Did you find something out?
Nothing in particular.
It's jumping to conclusions to blame the twisted bridge and the strange occurrence in the river on mutants.
column3: لا يمكنك إتهام المتحولين... بتدمير الجسر وما حدث للنهر أيضاً.

column2: However, the U-Men's mutant detection device found a strong signal.
column3: على أية حال... لكن جهاز تتبع المتحولين لدى... الـ(يو مين) كان يعطي مؤشرات قوية.

column2: I can't understand that.
But I'm surprised.
Little Hisako becoming a member of the X-Men!
When I remembered the Sasaki Institute, Professor X was happy, too.
column3: أظن بأن البروفيسور (إكس) سيكون أفضل حالاً لو أمكنني تذكر أكاديمية (ساساكي) في ذلك الوقت.

column2: Charles was...
Will Professor X be joining you here as well?
column3: هل سيلتحق بكم البروفيسور (إكس) إلى هنا ؟

column2: No. He left the investigation to us.
-l see.
-What exactly is this Sasaki Academy?
We were never as big as the Xavier Institute, but we took in the mutant children from the area temporarily.
column3: إنها ليست كبيرة كمعهد (إكزافير)، لكننا أخذنا الأطفال المتحولين فيها من المنطقة بشكل مؤقت.

column2: So, are you also a mutant?
-ln that case, why?
I wanted to do something for the children who were snubbed and couldn't go to school, just because they were mutants.
column3: أردت أن أفعل شيئاً للأطفال الذين عوملوا بشكل سيىء... ولا يستطيعون الذهاب للمدارس العادية... فقط لأنهم كانوا متحولين.

column2: But... I suppose there were limits to what I could do alone.
column3: لكن كان هناك حدوداً لما يمكن أن أفعله لوحدي.

column2: So you shut it down?
Yes. Now I use the facility for medical and mutant research.
column3: والآن أستخدم المنشأ لإجراء بحوث طبية متعلقة بالمتحولين.

column2: You know, Dr. Sasaki, I... I was really good friends with a kid in school.
column3: أتعرفين، دكتورة (ساساكي)، أنا... لقد كان أحظى بصداقة جيدة مع طفل في المدرسة.

column2: Good friends?
Yeah. I think that kid was a little younger than me.
column3: نعم، إذا كنت أتذكر، كان الطفل أصغر مني بقليل...

column2: It was a boy, but... I can't remember him no matter how hard I try.
column3: وقد كان صبياً، لكن... لا أستطيع تذكره مهما حاولت بشدة.

column2: Dr. Sasaki, do you remember him?
Back then I had so many children here. I really don't remember.
column3: حسناً، كان هناك الكثير من الأطفال لا يمكنني تذكرهم جميعاً حقاً.

column2: It's almost time for the meeting.
These are the members of my research team. From the left, this is Koichi Kaga,
column3: هؤلاء هم أعضاء فريق البحث، من اليسار (كاجا كويشي)،

column2: Jun Sanada, and Riko Nirasaki.
And these are the X-Men.
I've heard about what you've done. It's an honor to meet you.
column3: لقد سمعت بما صنعتموه، إنه لشرف لي مقابلتكم.

column2: -That's everyone?
Go ahead.
The weather appears to be clearing.
It might be a good time to go check on the Blackbird.
I'm sorry to trouble you, but could I borrow some tools?
column3: آسف لازعاجك، لكن أيمكنني استعارة بعض الأدوات ؟

column2: -l'll go, too.
-l'm coming, too.
You talk to Hisako and Emma.
The research facility is in the back of this house.
column3: أهناك وسيلة للأبحاث خلف هذا المنزل ؟

column2: The main equipment is underground.
A boy...
Younger than me...
Hisako.
You used to go to an ordinary school, right?
column3: لقد كنت ترتادين مدرسة عادية، صحيح ؟

column2: Yeah. I used to come to the Academy after my regular school let out.
column3: أجل، لقد كنت أذهب إلى معهد (ساساكي) بعد إنتهاء المدرسة.

column2: Maybe that boy was a friend of yours at school?
column3: لربما كان ذلك الفتى معك في المدرسة العادية ؟

column2: -Maybe...
-By the way, Yui.
Aren't you an acquaintance of Professor X?
Yes. It was more than 15 years ago, but I did meet him once.
column3: نعم، كان ذلك قبل أكثر من 15 عاماً، لكنني قابلته مرة واحدة فقط.

column2: More than 15 years ago?
But we were never close.
It was such a long time ago, I don't really remember.
column3: كان ذلك منذ زمن بعيد، لا أتذكر ذلك حقاً.

column2: I have to go to a meeting, so please make yourselves at home.
column3: لديّ اجتماع عليّ حضوره، المعذرة، يجب أن أنصرف.

column2: If you need anything, you can reach me on this intercom.
column3: إن احتجتم لأي شي، اتصلوا عليّ بواسطة "الأنتركم".

column2: I feel like Dr. Sasaki's changed.
Changed?
Yeah. She used to be kinder and warmer, I think.
column3: أجل، اعتادت أن تكون لطيفة وأدفأ، كما أظن.

column2: She still seems kind, at least to me.
column3: لا زالت تبدو كذلك، بالنسبة لي على الأقل.

column2: That's true, but...
Yui Sasaki is lying.
She said she hasn't seen Professor X in 15 years.
column3: قالت بأنها لم ترى البروفيسور (إكس) منذ 15 عاماً.

column2: But she has seen him since then.
Did you read her mind?
It's because of things like that that people hate mutants.
column3: بسبب أشياء كهذه البشر يكرهون المتحولين.

column2: No. I didn't use telepathy.
This is a woman's intuition, right?
A woman's intuition?
When we mentioned the Professor, she called him "Charles."
Even though they weren't that close.
Some people use first names even with people they're not friendly with.
column3: بعض الناس يستخدمون الأسماء الأولى حتى مع الناس الغير مقربين منهم.

column2: But she had asked you if Professor X was planning on coming.
column3: لكنها سألتك إن كان البروفيسور (إكس) يخطط للمجيىء.

column2: Yui Sasaki is involved with Professor X on a much deeper level.
column3: (يوي ساساكي) والبروفيسور (إكس) لديهما علاقة على مستوى أعمق.

column2: A deeper level...
-All right, let's pull it out!
-That's impossible.
Storm!
Could you melt all this ice?
That's also impossible. Look at this snow.
column3: ذلك مستحيل أيضاً، انظرا إلى هذا الثلج.

column2: I wonder if you could even call it snow.
column3: أتسائل إن أمكنني أن أدعوه بثلج حتى.

column2: At first glance, it seems like snow, but...
It doesn't melt. It's not even cold.
It seems more like a mineral.
So in Japan they have diamond or ruby snow?
column3: أهذا يعني أنها تثلج ياقوتاً أو ماساً في (اليابان) ؟

column2: Of course not.
It's as ifjust this place was suddenly changed.
column3: كما يبدو أن هذا المكان قد تغير فجأة.

column2: At any rate, there's nothing we can do like this.
column3: على أية حال، لا يمكننا فعل شيء كهذا.

column2: I'll contact Charles and have him send a spare Blackbird.
column3: سأتصل بـ(تشارلز) ليرسل لنا الـ(بلاك بيرد) الاحتياطي.

column2: Yui Sasaki?
Yes, I thought I'd let you know, just in case.
column3: أجل، ظننت بأنه يجب أن تعرف، تحسباً.

column2: Understood. ln any event, I'll send you the backup jet at once.
column3: مفهوم، على كل حال، سأرسل لك طائرة الاسناد.

column2: -It's been a while.
-Yui.
I wasn't expecting you to contact me.
column3: لم أكن أتوقع بأنك ستتصلين بي.

column2: From the sound of it, you've already heard a report about me.
column3: يبدو من صوتك أنك حصلت على تقرير عني.

column2: I hear you've shut down the Academy.
Let me just state my business. I want to continue my research here in peace.
column3: دعني أتولى أعمالي، أنا بحاجة للاستمرار بأبحاثي هنا في سلام.

column2: Are you saying the X-Men are in the way?
column3: أتقولين بأن الـ(إكس مين) يعترضون الطريق ؟

column2: I'll help if needed. But I want them out of here as soon as the investigation is over.
column3: سأساعدهم إن احتاجوني، لكنني أريدهم خارج هذا المكان ريثما أنتهي من التحقيق.

column2: would something be disturbed if they stay too long?
column3: أستكون هناك مشكلة إذا بقوا لفترة أطول ؟

column2: It may be the key to solving the string of mutant occurrences around your lab.
column3: السر وراء حوادث المتحولين قد تقع بالقرب من مختبر أبحاثك.

column2: I have nothing to do with it.
I'm not so sure about that. When I sent my mind to Tohoku,
column3: أنا لست متأكداً بشأن ذلك، عندما أوجه عقلي نحو (توهوكو)،

column2: I saw you and a boy.
I couldn't see his face, but you overlapped with him.
column3: لم أستطع رؤية وجهه، لكنك كنت متداخلة معه.

column2: Does that boy have anything to do with you?
column3: هل لديك أية علاقة مع ذلك الفتى ؟

column2: Why did he enter my mind?
Answer me, Yui.
That boy is probably Takeo.
column3: من المحتمل أن ذلك الفتى هو (تاكيو).

column2: Takeo?
He's my son. Mine...
And yours.
Our son?
You're telling me I have a son?
So then that was...
My son entered my consciousness.
That is incorrect.
If you say you saw him, then you just happened to look in my mind.
column3: إن قلت أنك رأيته، إذن فقد رأيت صورته في عقلي.

column2: But I'm certain I met that boy.
column3: لكنني متأكد أنني قابلت ذلك الفتى.

column2: You said you couldn't see his face. That's natural.
column3: لقد قلت بأنك لا تستطيع رؤية وجهه، ذلك طبيعي.

column2: Because Takeo is already gone.
Do you mean our son is dead?
Someday I'll tell you everything.
But for now, please stop meddling in my affairs.
column3: ولكن الآن، من فضلك توقف عن التدخل في شؤوني.

column2: Staying here is pointless.
In the meantime, let's go back to the Sasaki house.
column3: في أثناء ذلك، دعونا نعود إلى منزل (ساساكي).

column2: An avalanche?
Doesn't seem like it.
is a mountain monster making snowmen or...
column3: إنه متحول متوحش يصنع رجل ثلج أو...

column2: What on earth is that?
It seems that snowman has business with us.
column3: يبدو أن رجل الثلج ذلك لديه عملاً معنا.

column2: So let's go say hello!
-What's that?
-Storm.
There's one here, too.
Greetings, ladies and gentlemen of the X-Men.
column3: تحياتي يا سيدات وسادة الـ(إكس مين).

column2: How do you like Japan?
It's not bad. The food is good and the scenery's nice.
column3: ليست سيئة، الطعام جيد والمناظر لطيفة.

column2: Then you'll have no regrets when I kill you here!
Sorry, but I haven't seen any Kabuki yet.
column3: متأسف، لأنني لم أرى الـ"كابوكي" بعد.

column2: Some kind of hedgehog monster?
Beast!
Did you pulverize him?
There was no resistance.
You are pretty tough.
So that was the aim of the attack just now.
column3: إذاً كان هذا هدفك من ذلك الهجوم.

column2: The greetings are finished. Let's meet again.
column3: لقد انتهينا من التعارف، دعونا نجتمع ثانية.

column2: I see. He can liquefy his body.
That's why he offered no resistance.
This is no time for analysis!
Let's get out of here!
Jun?
I'm going to take my shot in my room.
Make sure the X-Men don't see you.
column3: تأكد بأن الـ(إكس مين) لن يروك.

column2: -Be careful.
-l understand.
Hisako?
is something wrong with your right hand?
The bruise on my hand is hurting.
Bruise?
It used to be bigger.
-Do you remember an injury or a burn?
Mom and Dad also say they don't remember it, so I thought it was just a birthmark.
column3: أمي وأبي قالا بأنهما لا يتذكراها، لذا ظننت بأنها مجرد وحمة.

column2: It suddenly started hurting when I got here.
column3: فجأة بدأت تؤلمني عندما وصلت هنا.

column2: -Has it ever hurt you like this before?
-l don't think so.
That's strange, I wonder if something irritated it.
column3: ذلك غريب، أتسائل إن كان هنالك شيء ما أثارها.

column2: -l'm going to ask Dr. Sasaki for an ointment.
-Hey!
-She told us to use the intercom, remember?
-It's all right. It's not as if she's going outside.
column3: ذلك صحيح، ليس وهي في الخارج.

column2: This is a good opportunity. I need to talk to you.
column3: هذه فرصة جيدة، أريد الكلام معك.

column2: Talk?
blackbird auto-piIot engaged. Launch preparations complete.
column3: تم تشغيل القيادة الآلية للـ(بلاك بيرد)، التحضيرات جاهزة للانطلاق.

column2: You want me to let you read my mind?
column3: أنت تريدين أن أسمح لك قراءة عقلي ؟

column2: -What for?
To remove your hesitation.
My hesitation?
I heard you couldn't fight the berserk mutant at the U-Men base and almost lost your life.
column3: سمعت بأنك ترددت في مواجهة المتحول الهائج في قاعدة الـ(يو مين)... واقتربت من فقدانك لحياتك...

column2: is it because of Jean?
The Professor proved I had nothing to do with Jean's death.
column3: لا علاقة لي بموت (جين) والبروفيسور أثبت ذلك.

column2: So what is making you suffer?
Hisako also asked me. "Help him," she said.
It's none of her business.
She's worried about you in her own way.
And I also don't want a leader who's so hesitant.
column3: وأنا أيضاً لا أريد قائداً يكون متردداً جداً.

column2: At this rate, it may impede our work as X-Men.
column3: في هذا المعدل، ربما سيعرقل عملنا كـ(إكس مين).

column2: Face your heart.
I'm sure Jean would wish for that, too.
column3: أنا متأكدة بأن (جين) تود ذلك أيضاً.

column2: -l don't like this.
-What's wrong?
Yui Sasaki said she introduced us to everyone in the mansion.
column3: (يوي ساساكي) قالت بأنها عرفتنا على جميع من في القصر.

column2: But I can still smell someone else in there.
column3: لكنني ما زلت أشم رائحة شخص آخر هناك.

column2: Indeed. She doesn't seem to want us there.
column3: بالفعل، لم يبدو أنها تريدنا هناك.

column2: Yui Sasaki's presence at the center of the mutant phenomena and the appearance of the U-Men seems a bit too much for coincidence.
column3: هناك أكثر من مجرد صدفة بأن يظهر كل من (يوي ساساكي)... والـ(يو مين) في مكان حدوث... ظواهر المتحولين.

column2: Seems we'd better keep an eye on Yui Sasaki.
column3: يبدو من الأفضل أن نراقب (يوي ساساكي).

column2: That's why I asked Scott and Emma to stay.
Scott. The X-Men are a light for mutants.
column3: (سكوت)، الـ(إكس مين) هم الضوء المشرق للمتحولين.

column2: I want to become that light.
And I want to continue shining a light on the future for human and mutant children.
column3: أن أكون ذلك الإشراق الذي ينزل على مستقبل كل البشر والأطفال المتحولين.

column2: I'm begging you, Scott. kill me.
You know I couId never do thatI
What did you do to Jean's heart?
I love you, Scott...
Now you die, too.
Dr. Sasaki?
-Feeling better?
The shadow you saw behind Jean, it's natural that you'd think it was me.
column3: الظل الذي رأيته خلف (جين)، من الطبيعي أن تظنه أنا.

column2: I was attacked by myself. What on earth was that?
column3: لقد هاجمت نفسي، ما كان ذلك بحق الأرض ؟

column2: That must have been your subconscious, the part of your mind where you can't forgive yourself for not saving Jean.
column3: لا بدّ أن ذلك كان لا شعورياً، جزء من عقلك يشعرك بالذنب لعدم تمكنك من انقاذ (جين).

column2: I... tried to escape my inability to save Jean by blaming you for her death.
column3: أنا... كنت أهرب من حقيقة أنني لم أتمكن من إنقاذ (جين) بالتركيز على فكرة بأنك قتلتها.

column2: You're right, the one person I can't forgive is myself.
column3: أنت محقة، الشخص الذي لا يمكنني مسامحته... هو نفسي.

column2: Now that I know you had nothing to do with Jean's death, what should I do?
column3: الآن وقد علمت بأنك لم تشتركي في مقتل (جين)، ماذا عليّ أن أفعل ؟

column2: One year ago, if I'd been there when Jean went berserk, I might have been able to save her.
column3: لو كنت هناك قبل عام عندما أصبحت (جين) هائجة، لربما تمكنت من إنقاذها...

column2: And you, as well.
Listen to me, Scott.
Aren't you the one who taught Hisako that an X-Man's most important quality is his heart?
column3: ألست أنت من علم (هيساكو) كيف تعيش وتصبح عضواً في الـ(إكس مين) ؟

column2: You need a stronger heart than anyone else.
column3: يجب أن يكون قلبك أقوى من أي شخص آخر.

column2: Don't let Jean's will go to waste.
I want to become that light. And I...
I want to continue shining a light on the future for human and mutant children.
column3: أن أكون ذلك الإشراق الذي ينزل على مستقبل كل البشر والأطفال المتحولين.

column2: So now you want to coach me, just like Hisako?
column3: إذاً الآن أنت تخططين لإعطائي دروساً، مثل (هيساكو) ؟

column2: The beast that suddenly appeared in the lab turns out to have an unexpected identity.
column3: وحش يظهر فجأة من المختبر، تحول في الأدوار إلى هوية غير متوقعة.

column2: Amid the confusion, Emma becomes suspicious of Yui Sasaki's assistant Jun.
column3: وسط الارتباك، (إيما) يصيبها الشك بشأن (جون) مساعد (يوي ساساكي).

column2: meanwhile, danger approaches Professor X as he flies to Tohoku from New York on the blackbird.
column3: وفي الوقت نفسه، خطر يقترب من البروفيسور (إكس). متوجهاً إلى (توهوكو) قادماً من (نيويورك) على متن الـ(بلاك بيرد).

column2: A new facet of the case is revealed.
Next time on X-Men.: Lost
column3: في الحلقة التالية من (إكس مين) بعنوان: "الضــياع".

column2: ♪ Ole, ole, ole, ole... ♪

Yes, it's unexpected, isn't it?
I thought you were some gold digger, but it's just your intuition?
column3: إعتقدت أن كاندي الغامضة كانت تغوي الناس لكن ما فعلتِه للتو كان الحاسة السادسة؟

column2: If the reason why you stick yourself to me is because of those ghosts...
I mean, those beings... then what's the reason for those being hanging onto you like that?
They come to ask me to do things for them.
They're not like living people... who can formally explains their situations and asks you for your help.
column3: لا يوضحون حالاتهم بشكل مؤدب، أو يطلبون المعذرة كالأحياء

column2: They always show up out of nowhere to tell me what they want me to know and they keep coming around me until I do what they want me to do and torment me to the point where I can't even get any sleep.
column3: يظهرون بشكل عشوائي فحسب وبعدما يقولون ما يريدونه، يستمرون بالظهور بشكل عشوائي ويعذبونني حتّى أقوم بما يريدونه

column2: What is it that the owner of that shoe wants from you?
She wants me to give this shoe to her husband.
She told me to tell him that she'll be watching over him.
That man probably is the shoe owner's husband, right?
He's one of the shop owners at Kingdom.
Then she must've lost her shoe when she came to see her husband.
column3: إذن، لابد أناه فقدت حذائها عندما أتت لرؤية زوجها

column2: This must be very special to him.
column3: أتسائل لو ذلك الحذاء يحمل معنى مميز لها

column2: She's dead. I'm telling you, she's dead.
This truly is a miracle.
She took it upon herself and died.
The way her husband was smiling was even scarier than the ghost herself.
column3: وجه زوجها المبتسم أكثر إخافةً منها

column2: When I got so scared earlier and ran away... I forgot to take one of my shoes in my haste to run away from the ghost.
column3: عندما ذعرت بالسابق، تركت حذائي وهربت بسرعة فحسب

column2: That's what it must've been like for her.
column3: لا بد أنها فعلت نفس الأمر

column2: What do you think it was that she saw... when she left her shoe and ran away?
column3: برأيك ماذا رأت حتى هربت وتركت حذائها هكذا؟

column2: I don't use my imagination on useless things.
column3: لا أطلق عنان خيالي على أمور لا جدوى منها

column2: I have a feeling that she saw something that made her very angry and upset.
column3: بطريقة ما، أشعر أنها رأت أمر مُغضب وجعلها تشعر بالظلم

column2: She's dead. I'm telling you, she's dead.
She took it upon herself and died.
column3: أقول أنها ماتت من أجلنا على حسابها

column2: If I told him that his dead wife was watching over him... then I bet he wouldn't be laughing like that, right?
column3: لن يضحك لو أخبرته أن زوجته تراقبه،صحيح؟

column2: Okay, good luck with that.
Go find out what injustice he did to her, and get revenge for her, too.
column3: إذهبي وإكتشفي من الظالم وإنتقمي لها

column2: - Why would I?
- I can't go back there without you.
I'm scared of her. I don't know what other ghosts may come up to me.
- I need you. - Ah.
I'm your special shield, isn't that right?
You said that you can't see them when you're touching me, right?
column3: عندما تلمسيني، لا يمكنكِ رؤية الأشباح،صحيح؟

column2: You said you want to run to me and cling onto me when you're scared.
column3: عندما تخافين.. تريدين الركض والتشبثّ بي،صحيح؟

column2: But by any chance... do they ever give you any useful information?
column3: لكن هل الأشباح يعطونكِ معلومات مفيدة ايضاً؟

column2: Like what the stock market is going to be like in the morning or where I can dig to find all the oil... or where are all the countless numbers of lost treasure chests buried at?
column3: ..مثلاً.. من سيدخل بإستثمار، أو أين ستكتشفين النفط ..أين ستجدين كنز بالبحر

column2: And if nothing else, do they tell you what the next lottery winning numbers will be?
column3: أو... من سيفوز باليانصيب الإسبوع القادم؟

column2: Then, I don't need you.
Your intuition that only sees and hears useless things holds no value to me. Zero.
column3: لو حاستكِ السادسة تسمح لكِ برؤية الأشباح العديمة الفائدة فقط، إذن هذه الموهبة لا جدوى منها

column2: But, let me give you one piece of advice based on what I've seen and heard here.
column3: على كلِ، سأعطيكِ نصيحة بالإستندام على مارأيته وسمعته بطريقي لهنا

column2: Because you go around doing what you do, in other people's eyes... You're just a crazy woman walking around with that tissue box on your foot. Someone who doesn't even know how to be embarrassed.
column3: الناس يرونكِ كإمرأة مجنونة لأنكِ تهربين من هواجيسكِ التي ترينها وترتدين صندوق مناديل كحذاء

column2: Get your head on straight... and just worry about yourself.
President Joo... you know that I'm not crazy.
column3: أيها الرئيس، تعلم أنني لست مجنونة

column2: - You saw it for yourself and believe me.
- No. I'm only going to see what I want to see, and believe only in what I want to believe in.
column3: لا، أرى ما أريد رؤيته، وأصدق ما أريد تصديقه

column2: I'm just going to see you as a crazy woman, and I'm not going to believe anything you say.
column3: رأيتكِ كإمراة مجنونة ولم اصدق كلامكِ

column2: Do you know what's going to happen with the stocks tomorrow?
column3: أتعرف كيف سيكون سوق الأسهم المالي بالغد؟

column2: Can you even tell me what the winning lottery numbers are?
column3: أيمكن أن تخبرني بالفائز في اليانصيب؟

column2: You can't even tell me anything.
Why don't you let me know some of these things before you ask me for my help?
column3: أخبروني بأمور مفيدة قبل أن اساعدكم

column2: Again?
I did have the shoes.
It is sturdy.
Nice and cushy, too. They don't seem bad to wear.
What is this?
It fell apart.
It fell apart!
What do I do? All the tissues are falling out.
Tae Gong Shil.
Kang Woo.
I'm on my way home after dropping Deputy Ahn off at the hospital.
column3: أخذت مساعدة المدير (آهن) للمشفى وأنا بطريقي للمنزل الان

column2: I was at the hospital, too.
Is she... okay?
I look like a crazy person walking around like this, don't I?
Wearing a tissue box to protect your foot is a proof that you're a quick thinker.
column3: لا، أنتِ ذكية لإتردائكِ هذا وحماية قدميكِ

column2: Right?
I wore it because I had to. I'm not wearing it because I'm crazy.
column3: كما قلت، كان هناك سبب لأرتدي هذا، لم أرتديه لأنني مجنونة

column2: But it's falling apart, and I don't know what to do. What do I do?
column3: ساكون بمشكلة لو تمزّق هذا مجدداً، ماذا سأفعل؟

column2: I think that tissue box is dead now after having completed its mission.
column3: ...أعتقد أن صندوق المناديل أنهى واجبه بحمايتكِ ومات

column2: I think we need to call in some reinforcements.
I see a taxi heading this way. Why don't we share it?
column3: هناك سيارة أجرة، لمَ لا نأخذها؟

column2: My defense line is wounded, but I found myself some new reinforcements.
column3: ملجأ الأمان من القنابل تركني، لكن أعتقد أنني وجدت ملجأ جديد

column2: No, nothing.
You're diverting from your path.
Be quiet.
I shouldn't have seen those.
But... did she sprint home with the tissue box on her foot?
column3: هل ركضت سريعاً وهي ترتدي ذلك الصندوق؟

column2: Where did she go?
You're diverting from your path.
I got it. I'm just going to go on my own.
Turn right.
What is this?
Right turn again?
Then it wasn't the right place earlier?
Your wife was driving with only one shoe on her foot. I thought she was drunk driving, but she wasn't.
column3: إعتقدنا أن زوجتك كانت ثملة عندما كنت تقود السيارة، لكن إتضح أنها لم تشرب

column2: - Is there a problem?
- No. I just thought that it was weird that she was driving while wearing only one shoe.
column3: لا، لكننا نجد الأمر غريب كونها كانت تقود بحذاء واحد فقط

column2: Kim.
Is he saying that something bad happened to my daughter which caused the accident?
column3: أيقول الشرطي أن وفاة إبنتي لم يكن بسبب حادث؟

column2: Please calm down, Mother-in-law.
I'm sure she must've lost her other shoe somewhere.
column3: أنا متأكد أن حذائها بمكان ما

column2: Did you look for the shoe?
You didn't find it?
Thanks for bringing me back home.
column3: بفضلك وصلت هنا بسلام، شكراً لك

column2: If you're thankful, would it be okay for me to ask you something?
column3: بما أننا عدنا، أيمكن أن اسألك عن أمر؟

column2: What is it?
The special person at Kingdom Enterprises that you spoke of the last time... is it President Joo Joong Won?
column3: عندما أخبرتني أن لديكِ شخص مميز في مجموعة "المملكة" هل قصدتِ الرئيس؟

column2: Is he also the reason why you started working at Kingdom?
column3: ألذلك السبب بدأت بالعمل هناك ايضاً؟

column2: I saw that he came all the way here to visit you the other day.
Do you two have a special relationship?
I wanted to know if it's okay for us to be coming home together like this.
column3: أعذريني، فقط أردت أن أعرف لو سيكون لا بأس أن نذهب بموعد معاً

column2: We wouldn't be able to do that if you're his special woman.
column3: سيكون صعب.. أن افعل ذلك مع إمرأة بعلاقة

column2: I'm not that kind of a special woman.
To President Joo...
I'm just... a crazy woman.
Then, let's continue to go home together like this.
column3: إذن لنعد للمنزل معاً بالمرة القادمة ايضاً

column2: Thanks for everything today.
Who is that man?
He's the Team Leader of the security team at Kingdom Enterprises?
- And he lives in Room 404?
- Yeah.
Does that man... know about your mental state?
If he knew, I doubt he'd suggest going home together after work.
column3: لو عرف، ماكان ليعرض عليّ العودة للمنزل معه

column2: Gong Shil.
The reason you're like this... may be because you lack energy.
column3: قد يكون لأنكِ لا تملكين طاقة "يانغ" الكافية

column2: Why don't you get closer to that guy and charge up some of your energy?
column3: صادقي ذلك الرجل وإستقبلي طاقة ذكورية كافية منه

column2: My energy?
You see it all the time in period dramas.
column3: في الفولكلور، هناك مقولة أنكِ لو تريدين طرد الأرواح الشريرة

column2: When a righteous woman sleeps with a man she is said to have dirtied her energy, and kicked out of her household.
column3: يجب أن تدخلي بعلاقة مع رجل

column2: The fact that you see those things... could be a sign of weak energy.
column3: رؤيتكِ تصادفين كل مرة أرواح، من يعرف..

column2: Who knows? Maybe if you receive some of a man's energy, things might get better?
column3: لو حصلتِ على طاقة ذكوربة قد تكونين بخير

column2: Maybe you're right?
I wonder if that man is special to me because he has really strong energy?
column3: أتسائل لو ذلك الرجل لديه طاقة ذكورية قوية

column2: That man? Who would that be?
- There's just someone.
- Whoever it is, just let him give it to you.
Suck him of his energy, okay?
How am I to do that when he won't even let me touch him?
column3: كيف قد أفعل هذا متى لا يسمح لي بلمسه حتّى؟

column2: Let's suck on 404's energy for now.
Hurry up and go to sleep.
You have to get to work in the morning so that you can come home with him tomorrow.
I can't go to sleep. What if I fall too deep in sleep and have it taken from me like the last time?
column3: حتى لو غطوت بنوم عميق، الأشباح ستأتي لمضايقتي

column2: Is... something in here right now?
Our summer revenue figures are doing great.
column3: ضربت أرباح هذا الصيف مستويات عالية !

column2: Kingdom is really climbing up.
Giant Mall will be opening soon. We need to come up with a plan of attack to make sure that they don't defeat us.
column3: مركز تسوق "العملاق" سيُفتتح تقريباً، كن متأكد أن تجد إستراتيجية تبقي أرباحنا

column2: This store has the third highest revenue volume in this place.
column3: هذا المتجر يأتي بالمرتبة الثالثة بالأرباح

column2: The revenue in this shop isn't all that great.
Let's just keep going.
This store has the highest revenue volume.
column3: هذا أكثر مخزن نجني أرباح منه

column2: - President Joo.
- Hello, thank you for all your hard work.
If there's anything that you ever need, please don't hesitate to ask me.
column3: أعلمني لو إحتجت لأي شيء، سأعتني بالأمر شخصياً أوه حسناً

column2: - But please keep up your great work. Thank you so much.
column3: شكراً مجدداً على جهودك، واصل العمل الجيد

column2: That poster was made when we thought Yi Ryung was going to marry the soccer player.
column3: (إلتقطنا هذه الصورة بفترة تجهيزات زواج (تي يي ريونغ

column2: Do you think it's still okay to be hanging that up now that the wedding is off?
column3: مازال يمكننا إستعمال هذا الإعلان مع ان زفافها أُلغي؟

column2: Look at how fierce it looks.
That poster is going to be a great piece of advertisement.
I don't think that Tae Yi Ryung is going to like this.
We've already paid her for the modeling fee.
Even if she doesn't like it... what can she do about it?
I like it.
She said this was the place.
The owner of this shop's wife died in an accident a few days ago.
column3: زوجة مالك هذا المتجر ماتت قبل بضعة أيام

column2: This shop is our fourth highest revenue grossing store.
column3: يُصنف هذا المتجر بالمرتبة الرابعة في المبيعات

column2: I think that Giant Mall has approached him about opening up a store at their mall but I doubt he'll make his move over there since he signed a contract with me.
column3: ..يبدو أن مركز "العملاق" بتواصل معه كي ينتقل هناك لكنه لن ينتقل لأنه مخلص

column2: I've seen something that makes it difficult for me to trust him.
column3: ..رأيت بعض الأمور لذا لا يمكنني الوثوق به كثيراً

column2: Look into him some more.
Look into it.
That shop owner's wife... did you hear that she died last week?
column3: سمعت ذلك ماتت زوجة مالك المتجر بالإسبوع الماضي؟

column2: I heard that he was so devoted to his wife.
column3: سمعت أن زوجها كان عطوف جداً معها

column2: That's too bad.
I've seen that couple, too.
I saw that couple here on a date... and they were planning on taking a hiking trip somewhere on their day off.
column3: جاؤوا عنا بموعد وكانوا يخططون لرحلة على اقدامهم بعطلة نهاية الإسبوع

column2: The husband seemed so kind.
The wife is extremely rich. She even opened up that shop for him, so of course he should be nice to her.
column3: الزوجة غنية جداً، ويجب أن يكون لطيف معها بما أنها فتحت متجر له

column2: I heard that his mother-in-law is even richer.
column3: العمة تبدو أغنى بكثير "سمعت أن لديها بنايات في "غانغ نام

column2: I heard that she owns a few buildings in Gangnam. Then let's think about this.
column3: ..إذن لنرى، بما ان إبنتها الوحيدة ماتت

column2: Her one and only daughter is dead... and the only person she has left is her son-in-law. Then all her money will go to...
He's hit the jackpot.
- Awesome. - He's hit the mother load.
Anyways, he's a nice man who was really good to his wife.
column3: على كلِ، كان عطوف مع زوجته

column2: So, I guess he deserves the money.
- Gong Shil.
- Gong Ri... If I'm the only person who says he's bad when everyone else thinks he's a good person... then no one would believe me, right?
column3: ..لو أقول أن شخص سيء بينما الآخرون يقولون أنه جيد

column2: Did you... did you see something again?
Gong Shil.
Let's stay here for a while and try to make a life here.
You have to do well so that you can continue to go home with that man.
column3: ..يجب ان تكوني جيدة هنا لكي تذهبي للمنزل مع الرجال الوسيمين

column2: And you can receive his energy, too.
column3: وتحصلين على بعضاً من الطاقة الذكورية

column2: I'm sorry, Gong Ri. I'm going to get going.
Bye.
I always feel like there's something lurking whenever Gong Shil stops by.
column3: أشعر أن امراً سيحل عندما تأتي دوماً

column2: Is... someone there?
Go away.
- Go, go away.
- By any chance... is that woman your little sister?
Yes, she is.
Why do you ask?
It's just that I... want to become friends with her.
Let me help you clean this up.
Doesn't he have any sympathy?
How could he have hung these up when she had to be admitted in the hospital?
column3: كيف لهم أن يضعوا هذه الصورة؟

column2: Let's go protest this right now.
- This is it?
- What in the world is this?
It's not bad.
Rather than getting pitied while dressed in hospital gowns... being seen dressed like this while kicking that ball seems to suit me better.
column3: ..اعتقد أنني سأرتدي هذا مجددي وأقوم بالركل بدلاً عن تلقي الشفقة من الناس وأرتدي ملابس المرضى

column2: Are you really... okay with this?
Since we're already here... should we find out who the woman that ruined my wedding was?
column3: أيجب أن نبحث عن الفتاة التي دمرت زفافي بما أنني هنا؟ لنفكر بالموضوع بعدما نأكل

column2: Tae Gong Shil?
Is she someone you know?
No, it can't be her.
Um...
- Are you doing okay?
- Yes. I can't take a day off of work over a small injury like this.
column3: لا يمكنني أن أخرج بسبب هذه الإصابات

column2: Um...
You said you tripped on something when you fell down the stairs the other night?
By any chance... did you see this shoe when you fell the other night?
That's the same shoe that I picked up in the hallway that night.
Where did you picked it up from?
My Yoon Hee!
So... did you come from that way?
So, you fell down like this when the shoe came off?
She... told me that the shoe was found right here.
This is very close to her husband's shop.
column3: وأعتقد أن هذا المكان قريب جداً من متجر زوجها

column2: That's where the shoe was?
Then that's just garbage.
column3: إذن هذه نفاية، وأنتِ جزء من فريق التنظيف

column2: And you're the cleaning crew. Throwing trash away in the trash can is part of your job.
You know that this isn't trash.
You know exactly what I'm trying to do here.
In my eyes... you're an employee at the risk of getting fired for your strange behaviors.
column3: ..بالنسبة لي تبدين كشخص كسلان يقوم بطقوس غريبة

column2: And for being lazy enough to sprawl yourself on the ground like this.
Those shoes.
Don't they look like the same pair of shoes as this one to you?
column3: رأيت ذلك ايضاً، صحيح؟ نفس الحذاء

column2: Right?
So what?
Even if I keep denying it and say that I don't want to know...
column3: ..بالرغم من أنني لا أريد أن أعرف

column2: I can't just ignore it when I see it.
That's just how I am.
Again... again... again!
I just saw something that I shouldn't have seen.
Honey, do you have to go hiking with your wife again on your next day off?
column3: أيجب أن تذهب لرحلة على الأقدام هذا الإسبوع ايضاً؟

column2: I have to keep going with her so that no one will suspect me when she has an accident.
column3: ..يجب أن أكون معها لكي لا يُشتبه بي لو هناك حادث

column2: Does your wife like to go hiking?
Yeah, she likes it.
Since she has no idea that she's looking around for her death spot.
Yoon Hee.
Hear me out.
So, you're wearing those shoes out in the open now?
Your wife is dead.
I haven't been able to wear them... because I was afraid of getting caught wearing the same shoes.
column3: خفت أن يكشفوني بما أنه نفس الحذاء لا بأس الان

column2: But there's no risk of that happening now. Be careful.
Once that old lady is dead... who do you think is going to get all this?
column3: ..عندما تموت تلك العجوز برأيكِ من سيطالب بكل ذلك؟

column2: She still looks perfectly healthy.
column3: هي تبدو بخير، متى تعتقد أن ذلك سيحدث؟

column2: Who knows when she'll die? She's not doing so well since the death of her daughter.
It'll be soon enough.
We've got the luck on our side.
Giant Mall is eyeing all our high revenue grossing stores for their own.
column3: مركز تسوق "العملاق" يحاول سرقة إتفاقيات الإيجار منّا

column2: We have to protect our stores.
column3: يجب أن نتأكد ألا يحدث هذا

column2: You went around and met with everyone today.
column3: لهذا قمنا بجولة وسلمنا على كل الموظفون

column2: My mouth feels like it's about to rip from all the smiling that I had to do.
But it was important for you to go see them since they produce all that revenue for us.
column3: ذلك إهتمام صغير لكي يبقوا هنا "خصوصاً متجر "داليا

column2: I don't know if my mouth feels like it's going to rip from all the useless things I've seen.
column3: أعتقد أن فمي يؤلمني أكثر عندما أرى صاحب ذلك المتجر

column2: The woman that Tae Gong Shil went after earlier is the employee at the Dahlia shop.
I heard that the owner of that shop recently lost his wife and has sunken into despair.
It worries me that Ms.Tae may do something wrong.
column3: أتمنى ألا تختلق الآنسة (تي يانغ) مشكلة

column2: Mother-in-law. What are you doing here?
column3: عمتي، لا بد أنكِ متعبة، لمَ أنتِ هنا؟

column2: You should be at home resting. Yoon Hee's no longer around to take care of you now.
So, I brought you some food for you to eat.

column2: It's not just because of that.

column3: ليس هذا فقط، ولكن قبلها عندما ساعدت الجُندي الذي ترك الخدمة على الإستسلام أنت أقنعتهُ بنفسك، لهذا يريدوا أن يشكروك

column2: - An army runaway?
- Yes, you did that.
I'm sure that wasn't me. Something's wrong here.
column3: رُبّما ليس أنا، شيءٌ ما خطأ

column2: It wasn't Joo Joong Won, but I bet it was 'Joo Joong Two' and 'Joo Joong Three'.
column3: ليس "جو جونغ واحد" و لكن ربما "جو جونغ إثنان" أو "جو جونغ ثلاثة

column2: This is all so ridiculous, it's actually making me laughing.
column3: أنا أضحك لأن الأمر غير مضحك أبداً

column2: That joke wasn't funny, was it?
No, it was all Joo Joong Won.
Since you're already here at the office... please finalize your paperwork... on the Child Abuse Center that you've agreed to open up and finance.
column3: ،الآن بِمَا أنك خرجت ،المال من أجل بناء مركز حماية الأطفال من الإستغلال أرجوك، إدفع

column2: I... agreed to financially support a child abuse center?
column3: هل أنا قلت أنني سوف أبني مركز لحماية الأطفال من الإستغلال؟

column2: Not adding another annex to Kingdom, nor adding another parking garage?
- But a child abuse center?
column3: ولكن، مركز حماية الأطفال من الإستغلال؟

column2: - Yes. That's what you said you were going to do.
column3: نعم، أنت وافقت على فِـعل هذا

column2: I'm sure that my aunt must be feeding me some sort of drugs.
column3: أنا متأكد أنّ عمتي تُـعطيني دواء غريب

column2: I need to ask her what kind of drugs she's been feeding me.
column3: يجب أن أسألها ما الذي تعطيه لي

column2: No. I think I need to go in and get another brain scan.
column3: هذا خاطئ، أعتقد أنني يجب أن أفحص رأسي مرة أخرى

column2: Chief Secretary Kim. Did you not find it strange... when I suddenly started doing things that I've never done before?
column3: ولكن، أيها السكرتير "كيم" أعتقد أنني كنت أفعل أشياء لم أكُن أفعلها من قبل

column2: Did the sun rise upside down during the time that I can't remember?
column3: ،في الفترة التي لا أتذكرها هل أشرقت الشمس من الغرب؟

column2: I'm not sure.
Maybe you had a very special sun orbiting around you.
column3: ربما كان هناك شمسٌ خاصة (تاي يانغ) أشرقت بجانبك

column2: President Joo seriously doesn't remember you?
No, he doesn't.
Amazing, isn't it?
At first, I thought that voodoo lady was just a scheme artist... but she really is gifted.
column3: لقد إعتقدت أن هذه السيدة دجّـالة، ولكنها ماهرة حقاً

column2: Are you sure you don't need to talk to him?
President Joo's completely recovered now, and he's perfectly fine.
column3: الرئيس شُفِـيَ تماماً و هو بخير

column2: It was unfortunate that he was hurt... but that was just an accident. It wasn't your fault.
column3: جُرحَـه سوء حظ، الحادثة ليست خطأكِ

column2: Yes, it was an accident.
I know that. But that really woke me up and set me straight.
I've always thought that people that are visible to everyone are much scarier than ghosts whom no one else can see.
column3: لقد كان يقول دائماً أن الناس مخيفين أكثر من الأشباح

column2: I met him after being scared by the things that only I can see.
column3: ،عندما كنت خائفة من الحقيقة و الأشياء التي أراها أنا فقط

column2: I was torn between my world and the reality.
I was so happy to be around him because that meant I finally found a space for me to breathe.
column3: لقد كنت سعيدة جداً إلى جانبه، بعدما وجدت مكان لأختبئ بهِ

column2: I never considered how deeply I had pulled him into my world... when he could see none of what I see.
column3: ولكنني أعتقد أنني أدخلتهُ، هو الذي لا يستطيع رؤية شيء، إلى عالمي كثيراً

column2: Although I can see... but I wasn't cautious enough so I put him, who can't see, in a dangerous situation.
column3: ،لأنني أنا، مَن يمكنني الرؤية، لم أكُن حذِرة لقد وضعتهُ، هو مَن لا يستطيع أن يرى، في خطر كبير

column2: I've finally realized that I need to get my head on straight, and live my life.
column3: لهذا، إعتقدتُ أنني يجب أن أستيقظ و أعيش

column2: I think it's true that people always have to lose something to see clearly.
column3: ،أعتقد أنني حتى أستطيع أن أستيقظ و أواجه الواقع الشخص يجب أن يفقد شيءٌ خاص

column2: You know that's not what this is.
I know that you really truly liked him.
Those feelings... what are you going to do about them?
It's sealed in here.
Since I'm still holding onto my feelings that I have for him they haven't disappeared.
column3: أنا ما زال لديّ القلب الذي أَحَـبَّـهُ، لهذا لم يختفي

column2: So, I will be okay.
I should be walking this way... so why did I feel the need to walk that way?
column3: ،يجب أن أذهب من هنا مباشرة ولكن، لماذا لديّ شعور بأنني يجب أن أذهب من هناك؟

column2: This was just a storage room.
When did this turn into an office?
It's the Special Guest Center.
It's an office that you had set up yourself.
Special Guest Center?
I created something so useless as that?
column3: أنا قُـمت بشيء عديم الفائدة كهذا؟

column2: What about you?
Kang Woo?
You're the new Security Team Leader, right?
column3: أنت رئيس فريق الأمن الجديد، صحيح؟

column2: The guy that Vice President recruited. You have enough credentials to work security at the Blue House, right?
column3: الشخص الذي رشحهُ لي نائب الرئيس الذي يمكنهُ حتى حماية البيت الأزرق، صحيح؟

column2: And this is?
She's the employee in charge of this office.
column3: إنها موظفة مسؤولة عن هذا المكتب

column2: This is her last day here, so she's cleaning out her office.
column3: ،إنها تستقيل اليوم لهذا كانت في مُنتصف حزم أشيائها

column2: Is there anything else that you'd like for us to do? No, I don't.
Did I leave... something there?
Ahh, my back.
Just leave your stuff here.
I'll bring them home to you later.
Actually, why don't I just come with you?
There's not that much for me to take anyways.
column3: ليس هناك الكثير على أيّ حال

column2: What kind of a weak seal is that?
No kidding.
I can't let you to walk out of here when you're about to cry any minute.
column3: بعدما رأيتكِ على وشك البكاء، لا يُمكنني ترككِ هُنا لا يمكنني فِـعل هذا

column2: I have my Gong Shil.
That Gong Shil you gave me is a huge comfort to me.
column3: الدُمية التي أعطيتني إيّـاها حتى تُرفِّــه عنّي

column2: I can even read now... so why do I feel so plugged up as if something's still stuck?
column3: ،يمكنني القرآءة الآن ولكن، لماذا أشعر أنهُ هُناك شيء مُعلّق؟

column2: Master Joo gave me this picture right before he was injured.
column3: قبل حادثة "جونغ وون"، والدهُ أعطاني هذه

column2: Is this picture the reason why the Chairman met with Master Joo?
column3: هل هذا هو السبب الذي جعل الرئيس يريد رؤية السيّد؟

column2: This picture was taken a year after Cha Hee Joo died.
column3: ،هذه الصورة ،بعد موت "تشا هي جو" بـِـ عام أُخِـذَت هذه الصورة

column2: He asked me to find out if Cha Hee Joo had a twin.
column3: لقد سألني أن أعرف ما إذا كانت لدى "تشا هي جو" أخت توأم

column2: I wonder... what Master Joo was planning to do by finding out about this woman?
column3: ،في إعتقادك ماذا كان سيفعل الرئيس بعد إيجاده لهذه الفتاة؟

column2: He was trying to forget about Cha Hee Joo since he met Ms. Tae.
column3: ،"بعد مقابلة "تاي يانغ كان يبدو أنهُ يُحاوِل ينسى "تشا هي جو

column2: So why... was he trying to find her twin sister?
column3: لماذا؟ لماذا أراد أن يجد توأم "تشا هي جو"؟

column2: There's something that you're not aware of.
The late Cha Hee Joo... was one of the culprits involved in President Joo's kidnapping.
column3: الميتة "تشا هي جو ،"في حادثة خطف "جونغ وون كانت هي المُجرمة

column2: What do you mean by that?
There's a very high chance... that her twin in that picture was her co-conspirator.
column3: يبدو أنا الأخت التوأم التي بالصورة متواطئة

column2: Are you alright?
You seem really shocked by this news.
Then...
Master Joo knew all about this, but why did he keep it to himself?
column3: الرئيس خبأ كل هذا و هو يعرف؟

column2: He knew right from the start that Cha Hee Joo was one of the kidnappers.
column3: ...حقيقة أنّ "تشا هي جو" هي المُجرمة كان يعرف بالأمر منذ البداية

column2: He figured out from that picture... that she had a twin sister, and that she must've been her co-conspirator.
column3: حقيقة أنّـهُ هناك توأم ،وأنّ الأخت الأخرى رُبّما تكون متواطئة لقد عَرِفَ هذا من الصورة

column2: There's a chance that the girl in that picture could reappear in President Joo's life.
column3: ...هذه السيدة سوف تظهر أمام الرئيس مرّة أخرى على الأرجح

column2: We must find that girl in the picture.
Hee Joo was a kidnapper... and Han Na was her co-conspirator?
column3: ،إذاً "هي جو" هي المُجرمة و "هان نا" هي المتواطئة؟

column2: No, that can't be.
Han Na was such a bright and kind child.
Congratulations on your acceptance into the university.
Thank you, Uncle.
- Your new parents are happy about it?
- I'm going to Korea soon.
column3: سوف أذهب إلى كوريا هذه المرة

column2: - Korea?
Uncle.
Didn't you tell me that I'm a twin?
column3: ،أنت قلت لي أن لديّ أخت توأم

column2: I want to go and find my sister.
I've made efforts to find her myself ever since I've been reunited with you.
But I haven't been able to find her.
They say that there's a special connection between twins.
I may be able to find her if I go to Korea myself.
column3: أعتقد أنني يمكنني إيجادها إذا ذهبت بنفسي

column2: I'm going to find her.
My sister is dead.
Why did you leave her all alone instead of searching her? - Han Na.
column3: لماذا لم تبحث عنها و تركتها وحدها؟

column2: - I hate you.
The dead girl's name was, Cha Hee Joo.
column3: إسم الفتاة المتوفية هو تشا هي جو

column2: Unlike Han Na, who lived a happy life in England... she lived a very unfortunate, and lonely life on her own.
column3: ،لذا على عكس "هان نا" التي عاشت بالخارج سعيدة عاشت حياة وحيدة و سيئة

column2: Remember the name, Cha Hee Joo.
And for the rest of your life... feel sorry for her.
I need to find Han Na.
It's a security alarm that connects directly to the police.
The police will come within a few minutes of you pressing that button.
column3: ،إذا ضغطتي على الزر في حالات الطوارئ الشرطة سوف تأتي فوراً

column2: We need to stay cautious until we catch whoever is after President Joo.
column3: ،حتى نَـجد المُجرم الذي طَـعن الرئيس يجب أن تكوني حَـذِرة

column2: I'll call you frequently, so make sure to answer your phone.
column3: سوف أتّـصِلُ بكِ كثيراً، لهذا أجِـيبي

column2: I'll be careful.
I told you that I've got my head on straight now.
column3: لقد قلتُ لك أنني إسْـتَـعدتُ إنتباهي

column2: I'm going to protect you from now on.
Kang Woo, I really appreciate that offer... but I don't think that I should... hold onto anyone, and attach myself to anyone.
column3: ،"كانغ وو ،أنا شاكرة حقاً ولكن، أعتقد أنني ليس عليّ أن

column2: Not holding on is my way of protecting him.
column3: عدم الإمساك بهِ كان حماية لهُ

column2: What are you doing here?
I'm not here to see you.
I came to see Tae Gong Shil.
I heard she no longer works for Kingdom?
column3: لقد سمعت أنها لن تأتي إلى 'المملكة' بعد الآن

column2: What do you need to talk to her about?
Just go back if you're here to taunt her about what happened with President Joo.
column3: إذا كُنتي هنا حتى تُـزعجيها بأمر الرئيس، غادري فحسب

column2: She's having a hard enough time right now without you adding to it.
column3: إنّ الأمر صعب بما يكفي عليها بدونكِ

column2: President Joo really doesn't remember anything about Gong Shil?
President Joo's aunt asked me not to mention anything about Gong Shil.
column3: ،عمّة الرئيس ،طلبت مني أن لا أذكر "تاي جونج شيل" أمام الرئيس

column2: I just came to see if that's really true.
column3: لهذا أتيت، لأنني لم أستطع أن أصدّق الأمر

column2: So, all that was true?
OH MY GOD!
Seeing how excited you are, I guess I can't let you go in now.
column3: برؤيتي لكِ متشوقة للغاية، لا يمكنني أن أدعُـكِ تُـقابليها

column2: Let go!
When I'm depressed, I need to see others more depressed than me to feel better.
column3: ،عندما أشعر بالإحباط ،أحبّ أن أرى الفتاة التي لا أحبها تشعُر بالسوء حتى أشعر بتحسُّن

column2: Why do you hate Tae Gong Shil so much?
I've always hated her, but I hate her more now because you like her.
column3: أنا كنت أكرهها بالفعل، ولكن بعدما رأيتك تُـحبّها كَـرهتها أكثر

column2: Don't you dare continue to like her.
If you continue to like her...
column3: إذا إستمرّيت في حبها، سوف أستمر في !

column2: I'm going to chase her around, hating her and taunting her.
column3: الذهاب لها و إزعاجها و كُـرهها

column2: If it upsets you to see me doing that to someone you like then stop liking Tae Gong Shil right now!
column3: إذا كُنت مُتضايق بشأن إزعاجي للفتاة التي تُـحبها، إذاً ! لا تُـحب "تاي جونج شيل" بعد الآن

column2: You really are a freak.
You really are a black whiskered whale that doesn't exist at all.
column3: أنتِ حقاً حُـوت أسود أرجواني، لا وجود لهُ بالعالم

column2: Black whiskered whales don't exist?
I looked it up.
column3: لقد قُـمت بالبحث و عرفت أنّـهُ هناك حيتان بيضاء أرجوانية

column2: There are white whiskered whales but black whiskered ones don't exist.
I'm pretty sure I saw those whales with the black whiskers on their faces.
column3: لقد كنت أعتقد أنني حوت لديهِ لون أسود أرجواني

column2: I wonder if it was just something in the water?
So you remembered what I said, and you looked it up?
column3: هل تذكرت ما قلتهُ و بحثت عنهُ؟

column2: Yeah, I looked it up because I don't understand someone like you.
column3: نعم ،لقد تسائلتُ كيف يمكنني أن أفهم فتاة مثلكِ ولكن، لم يكُن هناك أيّ شيء

column2: Because you want to keep me in your pond?
column3: هل تُفكر بتربيتي في حوضك الخاص؟

column2: I already told you that I don't want any part of that.
column3: لقد قلت لكِ، أنني لن أمتلك حوض

column2: You don't need to take care of me.
column3: لا بأس إذا كان ليس لديك واحد

column2: Just open yourself up to me.
I'm such an odd freak, I'll be able to eat and survive on my own
column3: ،حتى إذا لم تُطعمني ولم تُـعطيني أكسجين

column2: You don't have to feed me, nor take care of me.
I'm just going to grow larger so that you'll never be able to get rid of me.
column3: و حتى أكون بأكبر مقاس بحيث لا يُـمكنك أن تطردني ! سوف أكون كبيرة

column2: Do you think... that she views me like I view you?
column3: ،أنا أريد، أيضاً أن أبدو مثلكِ، لها؟

column2: Do you find what I'm doing pathetic?
It's cool.
- It's cool?
- Being confident without begging...
column3: لأنهُ بدون تسوّل، ولا سلوككِ الجريئ

column2: - It's very cool.
Yeah. Seeing you has given me strength.
Because I was feeling pretty pathetic just about a minute ago.
column3: حتى منذ لحظة مضت، كنت أشعر بالسوء

column2: But I think I need to become as cool as you.
column3: أنا أريد أن أكون لطيف مثلكِ

column2: What the heck?
Are you saying that you're going to do that for Tae Gong Shil like what I did for you?
column3: هل تقول أنك سوف تتصرف مثلي أمام تاي جونج شيل"؟

column2: Thanks. You just taught me something.
column3: شكراً لكِ، لقد تعلّمت شيء آخر منكِ

column2: So, all I did was just give him more courage to go to Gong Shil?
column3: إذاً، هل أنا قُـمتُ للتوّ بتشجيعه هُناك؟

column2: Kang Woo can't go to Tae Gong Shil like I do to him.
column3: لا يُمكن أن يلتصق بــ "تاي جونج شيل" مثلما أفعل معهُ

column2: I'm Dooley.
Something that doesn't exist on this earth.
Dooley?
I'm such an odd freak that even if you ignore me and not take care of me...
column3: ،أنا رجُل غريب الأطوار، حتى لو قمتي برفضه

column2: I'll survive just fine, and grow big all on my own.
So, that I'll grow big as a dinosaur that you'll never be able to ignore me.
column3: وسوف أكْـبُر مثل الديناصور، حتى لا تكوني قادرة على تجاهُلي

column2: Kang Woo.
Gong Shil.
I can't allow Dooley to fall into Gong Shil's arms.
column3: لا يُمكنني أن أدَع "دوللي" يَـرمِي بنفسهُ في ذراع "جونج شيل

column2: I told you that I'd introduce her to you, didn't I?
column3: أنا قدمتكما لبعضكما في المستشفى، أليس كذلك؟

column2: This is Han Na, whom you met at the hospital.
She helped me out a lot that day.
I don't think President Joo likes it when you bring a stranger into his home... I don't think.
column3: إحضارُ شخص لا يعرفهُ إلى منزلهُ، أنا لا أعتقد أن ...الرئيس سيفعل هذا

column2: Aunt.
I found these books here. Was I reading these books?
column3: هذه الكتب هنا، هل كنت أقرأهم؟

column2: They were in your home, so I'm sure they're yours.
column3: بما أنهم كانوا هنا، أعتقد أنهم لك

column2: You realized that you can read again when you saw those books, right?
column3: بعدما إستيقظت، أنت عرفت أنك يمكنك القرآءة من خلال هذه الكُتب

column2: Try to remember.
It has something to do with a very special person...
column3: هذا يبدو أنهُ كتاب خاص يتصل ...بشخص...

column2: A special person?
Was there a special person in my life?
Those... are my books.
I left it here on that day when I was introduced to your maid.
column3: ،في المرة الماضية عندما كُـنت هنا، أنا قدّمتهم للخادمة

column2: I forgot and left them here.
Oh! That's right, you did.
Han Na brought those books here.
They're just children's books, but it's still a great story.
column3: أعرف أنهم كُتب أطفال فحسب ،ولكنهم جيّدين

column2: The illustrations are great, too. Those books are very special to me.
column3: و الصور جميلة، أنا أُقدّر هذه الكُتـُـب كثيراً ( كأنها بمثابة كنـــز )

column2: So, my books was the first thing you read since you regained your consciousness?
That makes me feel pretty good to hear that.
Didn't you say that Han Na was the first person you saw when you regained your consciousness?
column3: عندما إستيقظت، "هان نا" كانت أول مَن رأيت، صحيح؟

column2: You two must be fated to be together.
column3: من الواضح أنهُ هناك قَـدر بينكما

column2: I'm even reading these days. It's a six book series and my brain feels like it's going to split when I tried to read those books.
column3: ،أنا حتى الآن أقرأ، هناك 6 كُتب ولكن بما أنني أقرأ

column2: So, he can read those books now.
column3: أشعر أن رأسي تتكسّر إنهُ يمكنهُ القرآءة الأن، صحيح؟

column2: I'm happy for him.
[Tae Yi Ryung]
Tae Yi Ryung?
Hi, Yi Ryung.
Hi, I have something important to tell you in person.
column3: لقد إتّـصلتُ لأنني أريد أن أخبركِ بشيء مُـهم شخصياً

column2: You know that restaurant where we all met up at the last time?
column3: أنتِ تتذكري المطعم الذي إجتعمنا بهِ نحن وأصدقائنا، صحيح؟

column2: Yeah. Meet me there, okay?
Those two were all googly eyed towards each other at that restaurant.

column3: إذا قُمتي بإطالة هذا، فسوف يكون مُتعب

column2: Yi Ryung.
I have a big fatal flaw, so I can't pretend to be weak and just grab onto him.
column3: أنا لديّ عيبٌ فادِح يجعلُـني شخص يمكنهُ أن يُمسَـك بهِ مُتظاهرة بأنني أستسلم

column2: A fatal flaw?
I think I know what it is.
You need both Kang Woo and President Joo to feel empathy for you and protect you.
column3: الشيء الذي يجعل "كانغ وو" و الرئيس يتحدثان دائماً عن حمايتكِ

column2: Okay, what is it?
I... see dead people.
There's one in here, too.
I think he was a patient who passed away in this hospital room.
column3: أعتقد أنهُ مات في هذه الغرفة

column2: I don't believe in things like that.
Okay. Anyways, he wants me to pass along a message to you.
column3: حسناً، أياً كان تؤمني بها أم لا، لقد طلب مني أن أقول لكِ

column2: He says he's a fan of yours.
I'm leaving now.
Hey, Tae Gong Shil! Where are you going?
column3: يــا! "تاي جونج شيل" إلى أين أنتِ ذاهبة؟

column2: If you leave me all alone after telling me something like that.
column3: لماذا تتركيني وحدي بعد قولكِ هذا؟

column2: It's scary.
I really hate ghost stories.
When I was being clingy, but even when I'm leaving... I'm still nothing but a gold digging candy girl in everyone else's eyes.
column3: أياً كان تركتهُ أم بقيتُ بجانبه، فأنا في أعيُن الجميع "مازلتُ "كاندي

column2: Woo Jin, it's you.
But... why are you still here?
column3: ولكن، لماذا لم تُـغادر بعد؟ *تقصد كونهُ شبح*

column2: It's Woo Jin's mom.
Woo Jin. Seeing you reminds me of a terrifying memory.
column3: وو جين"، كُلما رأيتك، تأتي إلى ذاكرتي أُمور سيئة

column2: Mr. Joo Joong Won.
You forcefully brought back the sun that was trying to leave.
column3: أنت بشراسة أمسكت بـِـ "تاي جونج شيل

column2: But, did you manage to have her rise at your side again?
column3: و تأكدت من أنها تتربّى معك

column2: - I'm the man that's leaving with Gong Shil.
column3: الشخص الذي كان سيُـغادِر مع "جونج شيل

column2: I'm sure that Gong Shil must've told you.
column3: أنا متأكد أنّ "جونج شيل" أخبَرتْـكَ عنّي

column2: I've met someone who can see and hear the same things that I can.
column3: لقد قابلتُ شخصٌ يسمع و يرى نفس الأشياء مثلي

column2: You're telling me that you see ghosts like Tae Gong Shil does?
column3: هل يمكنك رؤية الأشباح مثل "تاي جونج شيل"؟

column2: Unlike you... I'm someone who lives in the same world which Gong Shil lives in.
column3: أنا على عكسك، فأنا شخصٌ يمكنهُ أن يُشارك نفس العالم مع "جونج شيل

column2: Ms. Tae!
- Chief Secretary Kim.
- How could you have left without a word?
Were you running away... to avoid Master Joo?
column3: هل كُنتي تحاولي أن تهربي و تتفادي الرئيس؟

column2: I wasn't running away.
- I was just going to search for something.
column3: لقد كُنتُ ذاهِـبة لإيجاد شيء ما ماذا؟

column2: The reason why I ended up this way.
I was leaving to search for a reason why I was made to be able to see dead people.
column3: .السبب في أنني الوحيدة التي يمكنها أن ترى الأشباح لقد كُنت أحاول أن أعرف هذا

column2: Are you saying if she goes to those places that she's been with you that she'll be able to find the reason why?
column3: ،إذا ذَهبَت لمكان ما كُنتما فيه معاً هل تقول أنها سوف تعرف السبب؟ "يقصد سبب رؤيتها للأشباح

column2: I'm not sure of that myself.
We can only know once we get there.
When you're not even sure of it yourself you were still trying to take her that far away from here?
column3: أنت لست متأكد حتى، ولكنك كنت ستأخذها إلى مكان بعيد هكذا؟

column2: That's not what's important.
What's important is that for the very first time... Gong Shil has started to take a real look at herself and who she is.
column3: للمرة الأولى، بدأت "جونج شيل" في مواجهة مشاكلها مباشرة

column2: She's hid herself away living in torment while avoiding others all these years, hasn't she?
column3: لقد كانت مُختفية و تعيش في البؤس حتى الآن

column2: And when you appeared, you were like a safe haven she could escape to.
column3: ،أنت، من ظهرت في هذا الوقت كُنت ملاذ جيّد لها

column2: But, now...
Gong Shil is considering stepping out on her own away from you.
column3: جونج شيل" بدأت تُـفَـكِّر بالإبتعاد عنك

column2: That's why I came to see Gong Shil.
What is it... that you can do for Tae Gong Shil?
Her memories from those three years that she roamed this earth as a spirit... I'm going to help her regain those memories.
column3: أنا سوف أُسَـاعِـدها في إسترجاع ذاكرتها للثلاثة أعوام التي كانت تحوم بهم كــ شبح

column2: Since that's when she started seeing spirits... once she regains her memories of that time... it'll transform Gong Shil.
column3: ،لأن "جونج شيل" بدأت في رؤية الأشباح من وقتها ،عندما تعود هذه الذكريات جونج شيل"، سوف تكُـون مختلفة

column2: - She won't be afraid anymore.
She may be able to accept her ability to see spirits, or... it's possible that she may even lose that ability.
column3: و رُبّما سوف تتقبل قُـدرتها على رؤية الأشباح أو رُبّما سوف يمكنها التخلي عن هذه القُـدرة

column2: You're saying that it's possible she may not be able to see ghosts anymore?
column3: هل تقول أنها ربما لن ترى الأشباح بعدها؟

column2: Whether she accepts her ability, or loses her ability... the defense shield you can offer to Gong Shil will become meaningless to her.
column3: ،أيّـاً كان، إختارت أن تتقبل القدرة أو تتخلى عنها ...ملاذّك سوف يخسر معناه بالنسبة لــ "جونج شيل

column2: Is Tae Gong Shil aware of all this?
column3: هل تعرفُ "تاي جونج شيل" هذا الأمر؟

column2: That's why she's coming with me.
So, you thought that I was leaving for President Joo's sake?
column3: أنت كنت تعتقد أنني مغادرة بسبب الرئيس أيضاً

column2: I was really only thinking of myself when I tried to leave.
column3: لقد كنت حقاً أفعل هذا لنفسي

column2: Now that I think about it, Candy is much more of a romanticist than I am.
column3: الآن أرى أنّ "كاندي" كانت ساذجة أكثر مني

column2: To leave like that for the sake of someone else.
column3: إنها حتى تركتهُ لمصلحته *تقصد ليست لمصلحتها الخاصة*

column2: I'm not that innocent, bright, nor kind hearted like that.
column3: أنا لا يمكنني أن أكون برّاقة و ذكية مثلها

column2: You've changed a lot, just like how Master Joo has changed.
You used to say that you were just grateful to have someone like you.
column3: أنتِ قلتي أنكِ تشعُري بالإمتنان فقط لأن شخصٌ يُـحِــبّـكِ

column2: The sun that was crumpled down below is now saying how she wants to rise high up in the sun and shine brilliantly.
column3: الشمس التي تدمّرت في القاع هناك تقول الآن أنها تريد أن تُشرق و تلمع

column2: And there's nothing I can do about it either. I'm at a loss for what to do.
column3: ليس الأمر وكأنني يمكنني أن أتوقف أيضاً، لهذا لا أعرف ماذا أفعل

column2: Seriously.
Then do you think President Joo could have the same misunderstanding?
column3: إذاً، هل مِن المُمكن أن يكون الرئيس سيئ الفهم أيضاً؟

column2: Do I really have to put on my Candy act?
I'm not sure.
I'm not sure where Master Joo stands.
He's Master Joo.
Even though I had to force you to come back...
column3: ،حتى إذا كُنتُ حاولت أن أمسك بكِ بطريقة شَرِسة و محاولتي لأجعلكِ تشرقي

column2: I feel like I can finally breathe again now that you're standing in front of me.
column3: لأنكِ وأنتِ أمام عيني، أشعر بأنني يمكنني أن أعيش

column2: Listen, President Joo. Why did you hold me back?
column3: سيّدي الرئيس، لماذا مازلتَ مُـتمسِّك بي؟

column2: I was trying to leave for your own sake because I knew I wasn't good enough for you.
column3: لأنني كُنت أقلّ منكِ كثيراً، لقد كُنت سوف أغادر لكِ

column2: Who do you think you're talking to?
column3: ما الذي تعتقدي أنكِ تفعليه وأنتِ تحاولي أن تكوني "كاندي"؟

column2: Do you think that I'm going to run over to you and hold onto you from the back just because you're putting on that act?
column3: هل تعتقدي أنّــهُ بفعلكِ هذا ، سوف أجري عليكِ وأعطيكِ حُضن من الخلف؟

column2: Was I being that obvious?
Did the blunt and brazen sun all of a sudden become a moon of purity?
column3: هل "تاي يانغ" الوَقِـحة تتظاهر بكونها قمر بريئ؟

column2: I just thought that you'd feel less offended and be a little bit more understanding if I told you that I did what I did for your benefit sake.
column3: ،لقد إعتقدت أنني إذا قلت أنهُ لك حتى ولو للقليل، لقد إعتقدت أنّـك لن تشعر بالسوء وأنك سوف تتفهّم

column2: Even if you come off sounding really blunt, I like you better when you're being honest.
column3: حتى إذا كانت وقحة، "تاي يانغ" الصّادقة أفضل

column2: I don't like it when you change who you are which only ends up confusing me.

I'm leaving for the sake of my own survival.
It's not that I hadn't thought of you at all... but my own well-being came first.

column3: لقد كُنت بائسة لكوني في القاع

column3: لم يعُد بإمكاني التَحمّـل أن أعيش هكذا

column3: غادرت كي أعرف لماذا أصبحتُ هكذا

column3: و إذا عرفتُ طريقة تجعلني أتخلص من هذه القدرة فسوف أفعلها

I can't promise you that I'll come back to you.
column3: أنا لا يمكنني أن أعِـدُك بأنني سوف أعود

I don't want to remain as the sun of misfortune at your side.

I never should've gone after you.
column3: لم يكُن عليّ أن آتي لإيجادكِ

column3: ،لحُـسن الحظ، لأن حياتك لم تنتهي وقتها أنت وجدت زاوية الحياة

column2: Can you understand what I'm saying?
I'm not a dumb street mutt. I got it, so you can give it a rest.
column3: أنا لست مُهجّن، توقّـفِي لأنني أعرف ماذا تقصدي *ّيقصد أنهُ ليس غبي*

column2: Seeing how you're able to walk around freely at a hospital when you once told me that it was the scariest place to you in the world...
column3: ،بما أنني أتجول في أكثر مستشفى مخيفة

column2: I guess you won't be coming back because you missed having your defensive shield.
column3: أعتقد أنهُ لن يكون هناك سبب لمضاد الشيوعية لأن يعود

column3: .يجب أن أجد إتفاق جديد إنتظري حتى وقتها

column2: I'm going to leave just like I had planned.
Then you'll be meeting some cops on your way to the airport.
column3: إذاً، سوف يتوجّب عليكِ أن تُـقابلي الشرطة قبل أن تغادري

You've touched every nook and cranny of my body.
column3: أنتِ لمستي كُل جزء في جسدي

column2: You even crawled onto my bed without my permission.
You even paid me for the privilege of doing that, didn't you?
One million won.
Didn't you just tell me that you understood?
Even if I understood, I have no intention of being considerate.
column3: حتى إذا فهمت، فإنني لن أتفهّم ولن أهتمّ

column3: من الآن وصاعداً، أنا سوف أفعل ما أريد لأكون مرتاح

column2: You can handle everything from now on all on your own.
Once I think that you're no longer afraid of ghosts, and that you'll be okay alone... that's when you can tell me to stop coming, and go back to my own neighborhood.

column2: That woman doesn't have any self-respect.
column3: هذه المرأة، ليس لديها إحترام ذات

column2: There's a definite reason why she can't let me go... and that's why she doesn't have the luxury to care about any self-respect.
I don't get scared when I'm sure of the ending.
column3: أنا متأكد بشأن النهاية، أنا لست خائف

column3: لقد قلت أنهُ هناك نهاية و الأمر إنتهى هكذا

column2: But still... I got to tell her exactly how I felt.
column3: أنا سلّمتُ قلبي الحقيقي "يقصِد أوصَل مشاعِره الحقيقة لها

column2: I love you.
Would that... have been enough?
I guess I must've gone as far as what I feared in my worst case scenario.
column3: يبدو أنني ذهبت لأكثر مكان شرير كُنت أتوقعهُ

column2: I totally forgot that I said those words to her.
column3: لقد قلت هذا، صحيح؟ لقد نسيت هذا

column2: The things I said to Madame Go... that was the worst thing I could've said.
column3: ...الأشياء التي قلتها للسيّدة "جو"، كانوا سيئين جداً

column2: Death, the end, and not being attracted...
column3: هذه النهاية، ليس هناك مستقبل لكِ"

column2: I don't want to retrieve those words just to complicate things again.
